author: Frank Abderholden
title: Waukegan basketball player killed, several passengers injured in Zion crash
text:
Suburbs Lake County News-Sun Lake County News Waukegan basketball player killed, several passengers injured in Zion crash Frank S. Abderholden High School sophomore died following an early Saturday morning accident in Zion where Flight for Life was utilized and several patients were taken to the hospital, according to authorities.
Zion police said they will be issuing a statement on Tuesday. A Zion Fire Department official said one person was transported by Flight for Life and several others were also taken by ambulance to area hospitals with different levels of trauma. 
According to the fire department official, the accident involved two vehicles around 12:30 a.m. Saturday at Carmel Boulevard and Galilee Street, which is adjacent to the Robert McClory Bicycle Path. 
Waukegan High School spokesman Nicholas Alajakis confirmed sophomore Malik Brown died in the crash, and the school's basketball games on Saturday were canceled because of his death. (Katherine Rosenberg-Douglas) 
"Our team found out earlier in the day and the games were canceled," he said, adding that mental health staff worked with the team and coaches, and counselors were also available Monday at the Washington Campus, where Brown was a student. 
A vigil for friends and family was scheduled to be held Monday night outside the campus at 7:30 p.m., and starting on Wednesday, a 48-hour Hair-O-Thon is planned at Top Choice Salon in Zion, where 80 percent of the proceeds will go toward Brown's funeral expenses, according to salon owner Tony Johnson. 
"It will start at 10 a.m. Wednesday and go to 10 a.m. Friday," said Johnson. "The money is going to help with his mother's expenses." 
Alajakis said it's never an easy situation when a young person dies, because there is always a lot of emotion. 
"Our hearts go out to his family and friends in this terrible and tragic situation," he said.
